text:
No i have a PRE_ACTION_EXECUTION Function that sends `POST` payload.
Actually the problem was that i was running in FREE developer test account. and it was generating issues.
Then i ran it for 500+ records in our paid account , and the actions ran like a horse!

Instead of the message `server response was empty`  it should have said run it in a paid account.

I have this on mine too - it is on the action logs for each contact/ticket/deal that goes through the workflow.
Every time it does the 'information' log (with the block status) and then the successful action immediately afterwards.

I've not encountered any issues other than this, and assumed there must be some reasoning for this logic...?
well it seems really strange because what if the association failed because it couldn't find an object to associate, in this case I want to go and create the object.
very interesting, I wouldn't have thought it mattered

I might be wrong, but I think the next step would fail if it could not find the object to associate (as it looks like this one is only information, and the next one is the action)?
I've not tested it failing though...
yeah but it seems like when the action is doing it's initiation step instead of actually processing it I don't think it should skip to the next action
